sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Gosper curve.
message_1: What is the total length of the fourth iteration of the Gosper curve if each straight line segment has a length of 1 unit?
message_2:
The Gosper curve, also known as the Peano-Gosper curve, is a fractal curve that is constructed iteratively. With each iteration, the length of the curve increases by a factor of the square root of 7.

For the first iteration, the length is 1 unit (the initial straight line segment).

For the second iteration, the length is 1 * sqrt(7) units.

For the third iteration, the length is 1 * sqrt(7) * sqrt(7) units.

For the fourth iteration, the length is 1 * sqrt(7) * sqrt(7) * sqrt(7) units.

So, the total length of the fourth iteration of the Gosper curve is 1 * 7^(3/2) units, which is approximately 18.47520861406803 units.
